page.title: 04THE GEDNEYS
page.content: On Saturday 11th May the parish church was crowded with over 300 people. They were mostly visitors who had come to a Reunion service. Many of them were Americans. They were united by the common name of Gedney or Gidney. A lady living in Kent, but formerly from Lincolnshire, had organised a tour for the Gedney Association which has hundreds of members worldwide. They attended a banquet in Peterborough and visited other parts of the country. They are very few people with the name Gedney living locally which must make sense as they presumably only took the name after they left the village, as a mark of a identification.
